Lesson 1: Why Program Evaluation is Important

Image by Paola Aguilar via Unsplash modified from the original

Reflection

Instructions: In the text boxes below, take a moment to reflect on the following questions and select the Submit button.

Importance of Program Evaluation

Instructions: Program evaluation is vital for maintaining and improving quality. Program evaluation ensures program accountability, continuous program improvement, and enhanced outcomes for children. Select each dropdown below to learn more about the reasons that program evaluation is important.

  • Maintaining a Child Care License

    Image by Juicy-Fish under Freepik

    To maintain a child care license, there are a set of rules that you must follow and you need a way to show that you have done so. You are evaluating your program anytime you review licensing regulations to make sure you are in compliance. The transition to evaluating other areas of your child care program should be fairly easy.

  • Funding

    Image by micheile henderson under Unsplash

    Program evaluation might be tied to funding. Examples may include:

    • The Child Development and Care (CDC) Program that offers payment assistance for families who qualify pays higher reimbursement rates to licensed child care centers and group/family homes with a level in Great Start to Quality.
    • Other programs award funding to child care centers that meet certain requirements related to quality, determined by program evaluations.
    • Your program may qualify for grants that are dependent on evaluating your program according to the grant requirements.
  • Ensuring All Children's Developmental and Learning Needs Are Met

    Image by pikisuperstar under Freepik

    Research shows a direct correlation between high-quality early learning and children's positive long-term outcomes, including increased educational attainment, healthier lifestyles, and more successful careers. Program evaluation helps teachers and other staff at early learning programs develop a shared understanding and commitment to providing quality care for all children, in particular children with:

    • various cultural backgrounds
    • disabilities
    • varying ethnic backgrounds
  • Creating a More Positive Atmosphere for All

    Image by drobotodean under Freepik

    Implementing change based on the data from program evaluation can lead to increased staff morale and staff retention, a more energetic environment, higher quality care for children, and improved family involvement and satisfaction.

  • Facilitating Continuous Growth

    Image by freepik under Freepik

    Successful program evaluation generates the data necessary to identify the strengths and growth opportunities for your program. The most successful programs continually engage in program evaluation in order to give direction as student needs change and new research emerges. As professionals, there is always room to grow our skills and knowledge in order to better serve children and their families at our child care programs.
